intro: Houstonia rigidiuscula, commonly known as the rigid dwarf bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, acidic soils in woodland habitats. It has slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
